headline: Microsoft (MSFT) Surpassed Q2 EPS Estimates as Cloud and AI Demand Accelerates
summary: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT) ranks among billionaire David Tepper’s 10 favorite stocks. On an adjusted basis, profitability also exceeded expectations, with adjusted EPS of $4.14 versus the projected […]

headline: Microsoft Locks In 20% Of OpenAI's Revenue Until 2032 In High-Stakes Strategy Shift
summary: Microsoft Corp (NASDAQ:MSFT) will receive 20% of OpenAI’s total revenue until 2032 under a revised agreement. Updated Revenue Share Agreement The new deal, updated in the fall, allows OpenAI to collaborate with other compute providers without giving Microsoft the first right of refusal. Some payments under the agreement will occur in the later years. Initially, Microsoft was entitled to 20% of OpenAI’s revenue until 2030, the Information reported on Wednesday. headline: At Long Last, Being Underweight Tech Is a Winning Stock Strategy
summary: Mutual fund managers who cut exposure to the volatile tech stocks that have roiled markets this year have been on a tear.  Nearly 60% of large-cap mutual funds are outperforming their benchmarks, the highest share since 2007, according to data from Goldman Sachs Group Inc. Large-cap core and growth managers have posted the strongest gains, helped in part by weak returns from Big Tech.  Tech companies in the index are down more than 4%, while energy and materials producers have rallied at least 15%.

content.title: At Long Last, Being Underweight Tech Is a Winning Stock Strategy
content.summary: Mutual fund managers who cut exposure to the volatile tech stocks that have roiled markets this year have been on a tear. Large-cap core and growth managers have posted the strongest gains, helped in part by weak returns from Big Tech.  Tech companies in the index are down more than 4%, while energy and materials producers have rallied at least 15%.

headline: AI Spending Boom Likely Has Erased This Key Supporting Plank for Stock Performance
summary: The largest U.S. tech companies are on pace to spend about as much money as it cost to build the domestic railroads, around five times the amount needed to create a federal highway system, and 10 times the cash needed to put a man on the moon.  The so-called Big Four hyperscalers—  Microsoft Alphabet Meta Platforms  and  Amazon.com  —are forecast to spend at least $600 billion on artificial-intelligence buildouts in 2026.  Add  Oracle  projected spending and the tally rises to $650 billion, a near 60% increase from 2025 levels.

content.title: AI Spending Boom Likely Has Erased This Key Supporting Plank for Stock Performance
content.summary: The largest U.S. tech companies are on pace to spend about as much money as it cost to build the domestic railroads, around five times the amount needed to create a federal highway system, and 10 times the cash needed to put a man on the moon.  The so-called Big Four hyperscalers—  Microsoft Alphabet Meta Platforms  and  Amazon.com  —are forecast to spend at least $600 billion on artificial-intelligence buildouts in 2026.  Add  Oracle  projected spending and the tally rises to $650 billion, a near 60% increase from 2025 levels.

headline: Modi’s Chaotic AI Summit Showed India’s Clout and Constraints
summary: Nvidia Corp.’s Jensen Huang dropped out after early promotion; Bill Gates withdrew later.  Mukesh Ambani, Asia’s richest man, had so much trouble getting through security that his speech — announcing the biggest deal of the India AI Impact Summit — was delayed.

headline: Microsoft Names Sharma to Lead Xbox, Recommits to Console
summary: Spencer, who has run the Xbox business since 2014 and was named gaming CEO in 2022 is retiring, the company said.  Xbox games studios chief Matt Booty will become chief content officer, reporting to Sharma.  Sharma, who previously held roles at Instacart and Meta Platforms Inc., was chosen for her consumer expertise and will serve as the chief executive officer of gaming, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella said Friday in a blog post.

content.title: Microsoft Names Sharma to Lead Xbox, Recommits to Console
content.summary: Spencer, who has run the Xbox business since 2014 and was named gaming CEO in 2022 is retiring, the company said.  Xbox games studios chief Matt Booty will become chief content officer, reporting to Sharma.  Sharma, who previously held roles at Instacart and Meta Platforms Inc., was chosen for her consumer expertise and will serve as the chief executive officer of gaming, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella said Friday in a blog post.

headline: Microsoft Gaming head Phil Spencer retires, insider Asha Sharma takes over
summary: Microsoft said on Friday gaming head Phil Spencer is retiring after 38 years at the software maker, in ‌a major leadership shake-up amid growing challenges in a competitive ‌industry.  The company named insider Asha Sharma as the executive vice president and CEO of the ​gaming division.  Sharma said she would renew focus on the Xbox console, aiming to "recommit to our core Xbox fans and players."

content.title: Microsoft Gaming head Phil Spencer retires, insider Asha Sharma takes over
content.summary: Microsoft said on Friday gaming head Phil Spencer is retiring after 38 years at the software maker, in ‌a major leadership shake-up amid growing challenges in a competitive ‌industry.  The company named insider Asha Sharma as the executive vice president and CEO of the ​gaming division.  Sharma said she would renew focus on the Xbox console, aiming to "recommit to our core Xbox fans and players."
